citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live animals.
citations.narrative:
The transport enclosures used to transport seven hedgehogs did not meet the USDA requirements. The primary
enclosures were presented to the inspection team without a lid and thus did not provide structural strength that was
sufficient to contain the animal and withstand the normal rigors of transport. If the facility were to attach the lid to the top of
the enclosure, the ventilation openings, on the sides of the enclosure, were not sufficient to ensure adequate airflow to the
animal.
A transport enclosure without a top could allow for the animal to escape or become injured if the enclosure was
inadvertently overturned. Additionally, inadequate ventilation openings can decrease the airflow within the enclosure and
impact the health of the hedgehogs.
Primary transport enclosures for subpart F animals must be structurally sound in order to contain the animal during the
normal rigors of transport, and contain ventilation openings that are at least 16 percent of the total surface area if on two
walls or at least 8 percent of the total surface area if on four walls. The licensee must ensure that the enclosures are
constructed in an appropriate way to ensure the safety of the animals during transport. Correct by 01 April 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Mark Sanderbeck, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
